intro: Cypella mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican cypella, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to Mexico and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are pinnately divided and have a slightly aromatic scent. Cypella mexicana is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
